column1: For this purpose, we follow the impact measurement and valuation approach. This approach refers to
the process of first measuring the physical impact, typically by way of ESG indicators, and then using
impact valuation factors to convert these indicators into monetary values. Attributing a monetary value
to ESG indicators makes it easier to compare sustainability and financial metrics. It also allows material
sustainability topics to be incorporated into financial accounting systems and, as a result, enables
meaningful sustainability management in line with financial indicators.
